qas.question: What position was held by James Forrestal?
What position did Eisenhower informally hold?

answers.text: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff

qas.question: After becoming sick, where did Eisenhower recover?
What was the name of Columbia University's alumni association?
When did Eisenhower vacation for two months outside New York?

context: Within months of beginning his tenure as the president of the university, Eisenhower was requested to advise U.S. <a0_0>Secretary of Defense<a0_0/> James Forrestal on the unification of the armed services. About six months after his appointment, he became the informal <a1_0>Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff<a1_0/> in Washington. Two months later he fell ill, and he spent over a month in recovery at the <a2_0>Augusta National Golf Club<a2_0/>. He returned to his post in New York in mid-May, and in <a4_0>July 1949<a4_0/> took a two-month vacation out-of-state. Because the American Assembly had begun to take shape, he traveled around the country during mid-to-late 1950, building financial support from <a3_0>Columbia Associates<a3_0/>, an alumni association.
